com.r2src.dyad
Class DyadAccount

java.lang.Object
  com.r2src.dyad.DyadAccount

public class DyadAccount
extends java.lang.Object

An account with all of its state stored server-side. Once registered, it only needs to hold on to it's auth token, which you can also pass to the constructor to construct a registered account.

Dyad Server API version 1 accepts re-registration of an account and will return a new session token when that happens. This should be useful to

  1. Update the c2dm_id when it has changed
  2. Refresh the auth token when it expires
  3. Transfer existing Dyad Accounts to new devices.
All the methods of this class are non-blocking and safe to call from the UI thread.

register

public void register(java.lang.String authToken,
                     java.lang.String c2dm_id,
                     Foo foo,
                     Handler handler)
Registers the account with the Dyad server.

Parameters:
authToken - An auth token as returned by 
 AccountManagerFuture<Bundle> future = manager.getAuthTokenByFeatures(
                "com.google", "oauth2:https://www.googleapis.com/auth/userinfo.email",
                null, activity, null, null, null, null);
 Bundle bundle = future.getResult(); // blocking call
 authToken = bundle.getString(AccountManager.KEY_AUTHTOKEN);
c2dm_id - The C2DM registration id of this device. Needed to receive push messages.
foo - A Foo object providing the callbacks for this request.
handler - The Android Handler of the thread the callbacks should be run on.

requestDyad

public void requestDyad(Activity activity,
                        Bonder bonder,
                        Foo foo,
                        Handler handler)
Starts the process of forming a Dyad.

This method will start the supplied Bonder activity to perform the actual bonding. After the bonding process is complete, this method will send the resulting shared secret to the Dyad Server.

When the server receives two matching secrets, the Dyad is complete TODO

public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.util.List<Dyad>> getDyads()

authenticate

public void authenticate(DyadRequest request)
                  throws com.r2src.dyad.DyadAccount.NotRegisteredException
Authenticates a DyadRequest by adding a custom header containing the session token.

Parameters:
request - The request to be authenticated.
Throws:
NotRegisteredException - If there is no session token. Handle this by calling register(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, com.r2src.dyad.Foo, Handler) first.
com.r2src.dyad.DyadAccount.NotRegisteredException
